intro: Geissoloma marginatum, commonly known as the marginate geissoloma, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins and clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Geissoloma marginatum is often found in humid, shaded environments within dense forests.
